arts.ttl: Italy vs Moldova 2-0: Average Azzurri Fail to Redeem Themselves
arts.sum: The good news is that this international window is over. Italy will now have three months to look in the mirror and try to understand what the heck is going on with the Azzurri, as a new coach take the reins. Tonight, they beat Moldova 2-0 at the Mapei Stadium in Reggio Emilia in their second Qualifier game on the road to World Cup 2026, the last with Luciano Spalletti in charge. The post Italy vs Moldova 2-0: Average Azzurri Fail to Redeem Themselves appeared first on The Cult of Calcio.

arts.ttl: Italy Player Ratings vs Moldova: Prodigal Son Returns Home With a Bang
arts.sum: Out-of-sorts Italy got off the mark in the 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifying with a scrappy 2-0 home victory over minnows Moldova. Departing manager Luciano Spalletti bowed out in style, even though Italy's performance in his farewell game flattered the deceive. arts.sum: The Azzurri suffered a hefty 3–0 defeat to Norway in their opening match which cost Spalletti his job. Italy should have no issues brushing Moldova aside, though.
